result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lance G Ott in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Lance G Ott.  Attorney Tomas Valerio for Trisha L Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin.  Parties request trial dates.
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued

9:04 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Lance G Ott in court.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Lance G Ott.  Attorney Annie Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. State gives update, plans to amend Ct 1 to a misdemeanor, requests counts 3,4 be found transactionally related. No objection, Court so finds. Witness E.C. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Venue established. Cross by Atty Vera. Witness excused. Witness R.B. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Venue established. Defendant identified. Cross by Atty Vera. State moves for bind over, waives argument for rebuttal. Defense objects to bind over, gives argument. State gives rebuttal argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over to branch 11.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:35 AM Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Lance G Ott.  Attorney Frank Remington in court for State of Wisconsin.  Set for prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lance G Ott in court, in custody.  Attorney Trisha Simmons for Patrick Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. De has applied for SPD and is eligible. Court reschedules. DE signed up for text message reminders.
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Tom S. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

02:48 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Diana Maria Van Rybroek.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
